_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The result of killing living creatures a: They must have done a bad deed to be experienced as painful either previously or later, or else at the time of death they undertook wrong view.
They're reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
They experience the result of that in the present life, or in the next life, or in some subsequent period.
The result of refraining from killing li: They must have done a good deed to be experienced as pleasant either previously or later, or else at the time of death they undertook right view.
They're reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
The effectiveness of deeds (a causal cha: Deeds that are ineffective and appear ineffective.
Deeds that are ineffective but appear effective.
Deeds that are effective and appear effective.
Deeds that are effective but appear ineffective.
